intro: Elacholoma hornii, commonly known as the horned elacholoma, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Elacholomataceae, which is a small and less-studied group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, horn-like structures on its stems, which are thought to play a role in its ecological interactions. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Elacholoma hornii is considered an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
